clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Dihydroergocristine is used in some countries such as Brasil as a single agent for the treatment of cerebral and peripheric vascular events L2649 To know more about dihydroergocristine as part of the ergoloid mesylate mixture please visit DB01049

contraindications.disease: Studies related to acute and chronic toxicity as well as teratogenesis and fertility has proven that dihydroergocristine is a non toxic and very well tolerated drug A32880 To know more about dihydroergocristine as part of the ergoloid mesylate mixture please visit DB01049
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Dihydroergocristine has been shown to present effect on memory and cognition This activity in the brain is been reported by an increase in glutathione in age related brain states A32880 The reported effect on serotonin and adrenergic receptors has also been correlated to an inhibition of platelet aggregation L2649 It has also been reported that individuals exposed to dihydroergocristine may present an amphoteric vasoregulating activity either hypotensive in hypertensive individuals or hypertensive in hypotensive individuals A32879 This action is performed by promoting a dilating action in the contracted arteries and a tonic action in the dilated arteries and arterioles L2649 The vasoregulating effect causes an increase in cerebral blood flow and oxygen consumption by the brain which correlates with the brain protective function of dihydroergocristine A32880 In Alzheimer studies dihydroergocristine reduced the amyloid beta levels in different cell types A32882 To know more about dihydroergocristine as part of the ergoloid mesylate mixture please visit DB01049
